question.title: Using JSch how do I check if an entry is a folder or a file?
question.body:
Situation: I have two PCs with Debian 12 in LAN.

From a Java program running on PC1 I have to delete on PC2 a known directoy and its contents.

Since the ChannelSftp.rmdir() method only deletes an empty directory, I must therefore scan its contents and delete the files first and then the directories that contain them.

For this I need to check which are files and which directories.

Unfortunately in JSch I did not find the methods equivalent to java.io.File.isFile() and java.io.File.isDirectory().

Using ChannelSftp.ls() you get a Vector entries,

But then how do I check if an entry is a folder or a file?

answers.body:
The answer by @cyberrbran is correct, if you work with one specific file/folder. But if you want to check on all entries in a directory (as you are deleting contents of the directory), calling stat() on each is waste. As you already have that information returned in the ls() result.

The ls() returns vector of LsEntry instances. And the LsEntry has getAttrs() method, which returns SftpATTRS with isDir() method.

For an example of use, see my answer to:
List complete hierarchy of a directories at SFTP server using JSch in Java

This is my solution method:

public static boolean DelDirectory(ChannelSftp chanSftp, String sPath) throws SftpException {
    Vector<ChannelSftp.LsEntry> files = chanSftp.ls(sPath);
    for (ChannelSftp.LsEntry entry : files) {
      if (entry.getAttrs().isDir()) {
        if (!entry.getFilename().equals(".") && !entry.getFilename().equals("..")) {
          DelDirectory(chanSftp, sPath + "/" + entry.getFilename());
          chanSftp.rmdir(sPath + "/" + entry.getFilename());
        }
      } else {
        chanSftp.rm(sPath + "/" + entry.getFilename());
      }
    }
  }
